alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 9:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Harris and Fort Bend Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Sharp Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:35 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 165.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:35 PM CDT Wednesday was 165.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 165.0 feet. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 165.8 feet on 04/28/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Cypress Creek Sharp Road 164.2 165.4 Wed 9 pm CDT MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 345 PM CDT.
